critique: The document is an executive order from 1915 requiring passports for all persons leaving the United States. It also details the application process for American citizens. The order seems primarily focused on border control and monitoring the movement of people, likely in response to the ongoing World War I in Europe. There is a slight tilt towards national security, but it doesn't heavily restrict civil liberties. The document doesn't directly address economic regulation, social inclusion, or federalism. It also doesn't explicitly expand executive power beyond implementing passport controls. Immigration is addressed in the sense that the order applies to all people leaving the country, regardless of citizenship, but it doesn't restrict or open immigration policies.
